info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
At 159 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Bethune, or 13 miles northwest of Burlington, moving northeast at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible.
This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Kit Carson County.
This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 200 and 205, and near mile marker 211.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
This thunderstorm is producing minor accumulations of hail, which will make driving hazardous, similar to snow or ice. If you must travel, be aware of rapidly changing road condtitions.
